commit_message:
Adding Scaling QoS for ScaleIO driver

Add 2 new qos keys for ScaleIO: maxIOPSperGB and maxBWperGB.
The user can specify those in order to get QoS correlated with
the volume size.
the driver will always choose the minimum between the scaling QoS
keys and the pertinent maximum limitation key: maxIOPS, maxBWS.

Change-Id: I089e1a24af7925ed9b5f4e791d4ff30c0bd418e5
DocImpact:
Implements: blueprint scaleio-scaling-qos

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 17:00:21.000000000', 'message': 'ScaleIO actual volume size model update

Report back and update the actual volume size that is created in ScaleIO.

ScaleIO volumes support sizes that are multiplies of 8 GB.
This change updates the db with the real volume size.
However, it is a partial fix, because the quota is not updated.

The boolean property sio_round_volume_capacity specifies whether the
user allows ScaleIO to create volumes with a size that is
not a multiply of 8GB, hence causing ScaleIO to round it up.
When set to False, creation of volumes with a size that is different
than 8GB will fail.

Change-Id: I10e699eab98715cf7c8cd79533fc9279e81dfbf6
DocImpact:
Partial-Bug: #1561560
(cherry picked from commit 79d2d63ad868b6898bd13327f6b81712348883b6)
'}]
commit_message:
ScaleIO actual volume size model update

Report back and update the actual volume size that is created in ScaleIO.

ScaleIO volumes support sizes that are multiplies of 8 GB.
This change updates the db with the real volume size.
However, it is a partial fix, because the quota is not updated.

The boolean property sio_round_volume_capacity specifies whether the
user allows ScaleIO to create volumes with a size that is
not a multiply of 8GB, hence causing ScaleIO to round it up.
When set to False, creation of volumes with a size that is different
than 8GB will fail.

Change-Id: I10e699eab98715cf7c8cd79533fc9279e81dfbf6
DocImpact:
Partial-Bug: #1561560
(cherry picked from commit 79d2d63ad868b6898bd13327f6b81712348883b6)

commit_message:
Fix fluentd multifile problem.

There is a problem on the current implementation.
Currently the new_source variable is an Array of hashes,
not a hash of hashes. The current impletation is wrong,
as it can be seen for the following error at the log gate:
http://logs.openstack.org/09/563009/7/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode/aa4faf9/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz#_2018-09-03_15_17_39
[search for fluentd_service.pp] as there are too many lines at the same timestamp.

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Resource
Statement, Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function
Call, comparison of Hash with Hash failed at
/etc/puppet/modules/fluentd/manifests/config.pp:6:16  at
/etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/manifests/profile/base/logging/fluentd/fluentd_service.pp:47
on node centos-7-rax-iad-0001722758.localdomain

(cherry picked from commit bfba3ad7ac522e114c9b3fb03d354680c3b38162)

Change-Id: If3c7043103c5b3c93fc5a684449498c7bbece1c3

"}, {'created': '2018-10-02 15:29:38.000000000', 'message': "conf: Gather 'live_migration_scheme', 'live_migration_inbound_addr'

We've got two competing sets of options, which accomplish the same thing
in slightly different ways (that we won't go into here):

- live_migration_uri (legacy)
- live_migration_scheme, live_migration_inbound_addr (newer)

Group the latter two together. Note that all options require
'live_migration_tunnelled' be enabled to have any effect.

Change-Id: I37ed4dae3fc3d16fe19c8ebcd7b1c2210459b96f
"}, {'created': '2018-10-02 15:46:27.000000000', 'message': "conf: Gather 'live_migration_scheme', 'live_migration_inbound_addr'

We've got two competing sets of options, which accomplish the same thing
in slightly different ways (that we won't go into here):

- live_migration_uri (legacy)
- live_migration_scheme, live_migration_inbound_addr (newer)

Group the latter two together. Note that all options require
'live_migration_tunnelled' be disabled to have any effect.

Change-Id: I37ed4dae3fc3d16fe19c8ebcd7b1c2210459b96f
"}]
commit_message:
conf: Gather 'live_migration_scheme', 'live_migration_inbound_addr'

We've got two competing sets of options, which accomplish the same thing
in slightly different ways (that we won't go into here):

- live_migration_uri (legacy)
- live_migration_scheme, live_migration_inbound_addr (newer)

Group the latter two together. Note that all options require
'live_migration_tunnelled' be disabled to have any effect.

Change-Id: I37ed4dae3fc3d16fe19c8ebcd7b1c2210459b96f

commit_message:
Use show_volume_type to check the result of update_volume_type

In test_volume_type_update, after calling update_volume_type, it
only checks the response body of update_volume_type, and we should
call show_volume_type to check whether the volume type is really
updated.

Change-Id: I6b7a58a47bab22286e4ff783e9053def4f692ecc

commit_message:
Fix order for restarts

cinder-backup should be, in case of upgrades, restarted after
cinder-volumes [1].

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/upgrade.html#during-maintenance-window

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593033
Change-Id: Iddcd77f2aeb117ba8b1f9c4e2e41f8da9339f72c

subject: Add multi-region support for Magnum
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-09 04:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-10-09 08:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-09 08:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-09 11:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 604d633d16652d2fe291d2a116ebbc95ec17bd91'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 04:34:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-region support for Magnum

Magnum currently tries to hit the first region that it finds
so it can fail to deploy clusters in multi-region deployments
non-determinsitically.

This patch makes sure that the region can be configured and
it defaults to the same one that Magnum is deployed on.

Change-Id: I136ba0caead3a5afe11152aaed7bae94af8906b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add multi-region support for Magnum

Magnum currently tries to hit the first region that it finds
so it can fail to deploy clusters in multi-region deployments
non-determinsitically.

This patch makes sure that the region can be configured and
it defaults to the same one that Magnum is deployed on.

Change-Id: I136ba0caead3a5afe11152aaed7bae94af8906b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-24 01:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extra_attr kwarg from RbacMalformedResponse

This patch set removes extra_attr kwarg from RbacMalformedResponse
exception because it is unclear how unauthorized policy enforcement
could result in an extra attribute being injected into a response
body. For such an edge case to even be allowed, there would have
to be a documented example of this. Besides, no test case even
makes use of it, meaning that it is not something we should
even support.

Change-Id: I8f63720fe02d63360a7e40c836d55b56eb657156
Story: 2003843
Task: 26634
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extra_attr kwarg from RbacMalformedResponse

This patch set removes extra_attr kwarg from RbacMalformedResponse
exception because it is unclear how unauthorized policy enforcement
could result in an extra attribute being injected into a response
body. For such an edge case to even be allowed, there would have
to be a documented example of this. Besides, no test case even
makes use of it, meaning that it is not something we should
even support.

Change-Id: I8f63720fe02d63360a7e40c836d55b56eb657156
Story: 2003843
Task: 26634

commit_message:
Fix source and version for vmware-nsx 11.0.1.dev86

The git pike branch of vmware-nsx is currently at
cadcbf7b0ce62756c65e4f16c7a75ab3a40623e0 and
http://tarballs.openstack.org/vmware-nsx/vmware-nsx-stable-pike.tar.gz
contains a directory named 11.0.1.dev86 which nearly has the same source
code plus some egg-info. There is no tag for this version in git. Fetch
the tar for that commit from Github to avoid caching problems.

renderspec fetch_source and obs service download_files have different
caching behaviour and both are in use. So stable URLs with changing
content will not work.

Change-Id: I77c928cdd5cb1547578542dbdd7159d290972147

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 08:33:32.000000000', 'message': "Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Change-Id: I829b9cfa16fbd1f9f4d33b5943f1e46623e1b157
(cherry picked from commit 66636373744f21f8f3a3de15e89f3a54ce04fb88)

commit_message:
Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Change-Id: I829b9cfa16fbd1f9f4d33b5943f1e46623e1b157
(cherry picked from commit 66636373744f21f8f3a3de15e89f3a54ce04fb88)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id3e87ce28348d247545ce979f6b34a1cb76beb8c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Allow fluentd to read barbican-api.log
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-08 09:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-10-09 06:25:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-09 09:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 09:05:42.000000000', 'message': 'Allow fluentd to read barbican-api.log

Barbican API uses uWSGI, which by default writes out log files using
0640 permissions and default ownership for the user. This means that the
log file in /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log is not readable by
fluentd.

This was tested via the following command on a queens deployment:

$ docker exec -it fluentd bash
find /var/log/kolla/ -type f | while read f; do test -r $f || echo
"Cannot read $f"; done
Cannot read /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log

Generally there are a few ways in which access is provided to log file
for fluentd:

1. Set log file ownership to $USER:kolla, permissions to 0640.
2. Set log file ownership to $USER:$USER, permissions to 0644.
3. MariaDB is a special case, and uses 0640 with the fluentd user added
to the mysql group.

Of these, 1. seems the most secure.

This change uses the --logfile-chmod argument to set the log file
permissions to 644, since it does not appear possible to specify a group
to change ownership to using --logfile-chown. We use command line
arguments since putting the option in the config file does not seem to
work. Perhaps it is an ordering issue.

Change-Id: If98ca7cd9630b5622132a00718cb09304b8285b3
Closes-Bug: #1794472
(cherry picked from commit 8e635db8f1ccc45f3c28c915bfd970c020455760)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow fluentd to read barbican-api.log

Barbican API uses uWSGI, which by default writes out log files using
0640 permissions and default ownership for the user. This means that the
log file in /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log is not readable by
fluentd.

This was tested via the following command on a queens deployment:

$ docker exec -it fluentd bash
find /var/log/kolla/ -type f | while read f; do test -r $f || echo
"Cannot read $f"; done
Cannot read /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log

Generally there are a few ways in which access is provided to log file
for fluentd:

1. Set log file ownership to $USER:kolla, permissions to 0640.
2. Set log file ownership to $USER:$USER, permissions to 0644.
3. MariaDB is a special case, and uses 0640 with the fluentd user added
to the mysql group.

Of these, 1. seems the most secure.

This change uses the --logfile-chmod argument to set the log file
permissions to 644, since it does not appear possible to specify a group
to change ownership to using --logfile-chown. We use command line
arguments since putting the option in the config file does not seem to
work. Perhaps it is an ordering issue.

Change-Id: If98ca7cd9630b5622132a00718cb09304b8285b3
Closes-Bug: #1794472
(cherry picked from commit 8e635db8f1ccc45f3c28c915bfd970c020455760)

subject: Allow fluentd to read barbican-api.log
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-08 09:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-08 09:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit d357b48eb10cfbb4c669302ae0d44a77dc6477e5'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-10-09 06:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-09 09:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 09:04:29.000000000', 'message': 'Allow fluentd to read barbican-api.log

Barbican API uses uWSGI, which by default writes out log files using
0640 permissions and default ownership for the user. This means that the
log file in /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log is not readable by
fluentd.

This was tested via the following command on a queens deployment:

$ docker exec -it fluentd bash
find /var/log/kolla/ -type f | while read f; do test -r $f || echo
"Cannot read $f"; done
Cannot read /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log

Generally there are a few ways in which access is provided to log file
for fluentd:

1. Set log file ownership to $USER:kolla, permissions to 0640.
2. Set log file ownership to $USER:$USER, permissions to 0644.
3. MariaDB is a special case, and uses 0640 with the fluentd user added
to the mysql group.

Of these, 1. seems the most secure.

This change uses the --logfile-chmod argument to set the log file
permissions to 644, since it does not appear possible to specify a group
to change ownership to using --logfile-chown. We use command line
arguments since putting the option in the config file does not seem to
work. Perhaps it is an ordering issue.

Change-Id: If98ca7cd9630b5622132a00718cb09304b8285b3
Closes-Bug: #1794472
(cherry picked from commit 8e635db8f1ccc45f3c28c915bfd970c020455760)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow fluentd to read barbican-api.log

Barbican API uses uWSGI, which by default writes out log files using
0640 permissions and default ownership for the user. This means that the
log file in /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log is not readable by
fluentd.

This was tested via the following command on a queens deployment:

$ docker exec -it fluentd bash
find /var/log/kolla/ -type f | while read f; do test -r $f || echo
"Cannot read $f"; done
Cannot read /var/log/kolla/barbican/barbican-api.log

Generally there are a few ways in which access is provided to log file
for fluentd:

1. Set log file ownership to $USER:kolla, permissions to 0640.
2. Set log file ownership to $USER:$USER, permissions to 0644.
3. MariaDB is a special case, and uses 0640 with the fluentd user added
to the mysql group.

Of these, 1. seems the most secure.

This change uses the --logfile-chmod argument to set the log file
permissions to 644, since it does not appear possible to specify a group
to change ownership to using --logfile-chown. We use command line
arguments since putting the option in the config file does not seem to
work. Perhaps it is an ordering issue.

Change-Id: If98ca7cd9630b5622132a00718cb09304b8285b3
Closes-Bug: #1794472
(cherry picked from commit 8e635db8f1ccc45f3c28c915bfd970c020455760)

subject: Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 03:17:33.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Id7eb248942aff41902dc1e8875530cba49fdf1ee
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Id7eb248942aff41902dc1e8875530cba49fdf1ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:53:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I26a7a792569de63f6cd9dd1ee7416cdf7532f092
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I26a7a792569de63f6cd9dd1ee7416cdf7532f092
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
daemon-reload after fuel-rabbit-fence installed

Normally this is not needed but for some reason daemon-reload
isn't called after fuel-rabbit-fence is installed.

Fixing it in library is a 'quick hack', normal fix should
be done on packaging level.

Change-Id: I87cc0c984d7a648b265df19ea543369c41cd8ba1
blueprint: mos-xenial

commit_message:
Switch to Ubuntu Xenial

Replace codename trusty with xenial.

Remove dkms packages because 16.04 contains latest drivers.

linux-firmware-nonfree was removed from Ubuntu Xenial,
so remove it from list of packages.

Blueprint: mos-xenial

Change-Id: Ic9d3062db06f6e6fe11c4cbb1de3ef36b34aa22e

[WIP] Upstream CentOS on MOS-8 master node

This spec describes how we are going to align existing
MOS-8 master nodes with upstream CentOS-7.

Blueprint: master-node-upstream-centos

commit_message:
Use shared neutron template fragment.

The neutron template fragment in charmhelpers has support for
metadata, so bring the pike template inline witt all the other
nova.conf templates in the charm and use parts/section-neutron.

Change-Id: I35514988aa9d2c289ec20dd3394846386cb1559e
Closes-Bug: 1796405

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 12:29:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit test run on OS X

It turns out that `os.uname` on OS X indirectly resorts to the
`exec` call which is intentionally mocked to fail. This patch
adds another mock so that the tests pass again enabling Mac folks
to engage in ironic testing! \o/

Change-Id: Ic48aed13d9ce262cb0d06ccc1d7c79f2fd2a365a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit test run on OS X

It turns out that `os.uname` on OS X indirectly resorts to the
`exec` call which is intentionally mocked to fail. This patch
adds another mock so that the tests pass again enabling Mac folks
to engage in ironic testing! \o/

Change-Id: Ic48aed13d9ce262cb0d06ccc1d7c79f2fd2a365a

Story: #2003850

commit_message:
Check for server in attachements when checking for detach complete

It's possible that the volume is already attached to another
server, which can happen by marking a  VolumeAttachment resource
unhealthy after removing the volume from the server.

Change-Id: Ia77e0462bf732224b491591d22584cbcfa779956
Story: #2003850
Task: 26643

commit_message:
Use WebOb 1.8.1

The requirements/upper-constraints file was modified to allow WebOb
1.8.1 by commit 88bafa11deb9bd7595983d97ffabca338f073ba3.  This
patch simplifies some Glance code that could handle both WebOb
1.7.4 and 1.8.1 so that it now only handles the latter, and updates
the glance/requirements.txt and glance/lower-constraints.txt to
reflect that we support WebOb 1.8.1+ only.

Change-Id: I03e03013927cc5434aa0d97657d5e7efd8223ee5
Closes-bug: #1770410

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 10:54:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/608631
Change-Id: Ia0fb41266a6d62073b02c8ad6fa97b8b7d408a67

commit_message:
Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/608631
Change-Id: Ia0fb41266a6d62073b02c8ad6fa97b8b7d408a67

the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Change-Id: I829b9cfa16fbd1f9f4d33b5943f1e46623e1b157

commit_message:
Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Change-Id: I829b9cfa16fbd1f9f4d33b5943f1e46623e1b157

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6de58b9ba9609056a09e8ea9f1f9637b3e4a939a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 15:09:23.000000000', 'message': "Fixed using 'os_auth_ver' parameter when passed via --config

Although using 'os_auth_ver' parameter is deprecated, freezer-api (or
freezer-web-ui respectively) still uses it to generate configs for jobs.
Commit 50df2c8 introduced regression causing freezer-agent refusing to
start when config passed via '--config' contains 'os_auth_ver' parameter
(or any other deprecated option). The root cause is that loop (L568)
iterates through keys defined in config file passed via '--config'
therefore trying to call CONF.set_override with deprecated 'os_auth_ver'
as a first argument which causes oslo.config library to raise
KeyError: 'os-identity-api-version' as CONF.set_override is not expected
to be called with deprecated options. This simple patch adds call for
get for each key which may (correctly) raise NoSuchOptError for undefined
(and deprecated) keys, thus safely fallbacking to except routine.

Change-Id: Ia554d440b6256eab0f953ed9ad75cff1f040e6a1
"}, {'created': '2018-08-30 10:48:38.000000000', 'message': "Fixed using 'os_auth_ver' parameter when passed via --config

commit_message:
Fixed using 'os_auth_ver' parameter when passed via --config

Although using 'os_auth_ver' parameter is deprecated, freezer-api (or
freezer-web-ui respectively) still uses it to generate configs for jobs.
Commit 50df2c8 introduced regression causing freezer-agent refusing to
start when config passed via '--config' contains 'os_auth_ver' parameter
(or any other deprecated option). The root cause is that loop (L568)
iterates through keys defined in config file passed via '--config'
therefore trying to call CONF.set_override with deprecated 'os_auth_ver'
as a first argument which causes oslo.config library to raise
KeyError: 'os-identity-api-version' as CONF.set_override is not expected
to be called with deprecated options. This simple patch adds call for
get for each key which may (correctly) raise NoSuchOptError for undefined
(and deprecated) keys, thus safely fallbacking to except routine.

Re-submitted.

Change-Id: Ia554d440b6256eab0f953ed9ad75cff1f040e6a1

Convert legacy jobs that are only used by tempest:

  tempest-full-neutron-non-admin

Remove job legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-test-accounts, this is
superceded by the other two full-test-accounts jobs.

Change-Id: Iede4f0016f58045073eae2d44dc6f5c2331f2803

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Conflicts:
    tools/tox_install.sh

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 07:22:15.000000000', 'message': "Register session conf options from keystoneauth

To enable split logging functionality [1] we need to register
'split_logger' conf option under [keystone_authtoken] section.

There are two ways to add this new 'split_logger' config option
under keystone_authtoken.

1. In Keystonemiddleware, as it is done for other config options
'certfile', 'keyfile', 'cafile', 'insecure' config option.
2. All above config options mentioned in point #1 are also available
to be registered using register_session_conf_options from keystoneauth
library including few others i.e. 'split_logger', 'timeout' and
'collect-timing'.

This patch removes explicit registration of conf options like
('certfile', 'keyfile', 'cafile', 'insecure') and registers it
from keystoneauth library along with other options like('timeout',
'collect-timing', 'split-loggers') under [keystone_authtoken]
section.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505764/

Change-Id: I641366cc857f585117eb7797543e18fdaed46561

commit_message:
Register 'split_loggers' conf option

To enable split logging functionality [1] we need to register
'split_logger' conf option under [keystone_authtoken] section.

There are two options to add this new 'split_logger' config option
under keystone_authtoken.

1. In Keystonemiddleware, as it is done for other config options
'certfile', 'keyfile', 'cafile', 'insecure' config option.
2. All above config options mentioned in point #1 are also available
to be registered using register_session_conf_options from keystoneauth
library including few others i.e. 'split_loggers', 'timeout' and
'collect-timing'.

This patch follows option 1 explained above to register 'split_loggers'
conf option. Implementing second option causing duplicate registration of
'timeout' conf option(DuplicateOptError) because it is registered at [2].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505764/
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/trust_auth.py#L21

Change-Id: I641366cc857f585117eb7797543e18fdaed46561

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5650993331a542fe5d512ad72cb4d9a8616ce8a4

commit_message:
Allow ipv6 ECMP in devstack

It turns out that a host can have multiple valid default gateways,
something that's not common in ipv4.

This patches add supports for multiple default gateways in ipv6
environments.

Closes-Bug: #1786259

Change-Id: I30bf655f7160dd19c427ee79acdf145671a3e520
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>

commit_message:
Use ceph-ansible environments during Q->R upgrade.

Change puppet-ceph environment files to ceph-ansible one
during Q->R upgrade.
This is for case when environment was deployed on P release,
where puppet-ceph is default.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 09:35:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix create volume error

When the ``volume_type`` is specified to create a volume and the volume
type name is in uuid format, the volume creation fails, so the
processing logic of the "volume_types.get_by_name_or_id()" function
needs to be updated.

Closes-Bug: #1794237
Change-Id: I83f12a5b858aced117286e8d2dee717d14dbdba6
'}, {'created': '2018-09-27 08:04:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong NotFound in get_by_name_or_id

When we create or retype a volume using the volume type which
has a uuid format type name, the operation would be failed and
raise a 404 error.

There are a uuid check in "get_by_name_or_id()", and the
uuid-like type name would be mistakenly recognized as a id,
will use "get_volume_type"(by_id) to get volume type .

So, this patch try to fix this error, if we can't find a
type by uuid, we need call "get_volume_type_by_name" to check
agiain can we get this type by name.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1794237
Change-Id: I83f12a5b858aced117286e8d2dee717d14dbdba6
'}, {'created': '2018-09-27 12:33:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong NotFound in get_by_name_or_id

commit_message:
Fix wrong NotFound in get_by_name_or_id

When we create or retype a volume using the volume type which
has a uuid format type name, the operation would be failed and
raise a 404 error.

There are a uuid check in "get_by_name_or_id()", and the
uuid-like type name would be mistakenly recognized as a id,
will use "get_volume_type"(by_id) to get volume type .

So, this patch try to fix this error, if we can't find a
type by uuid, we need call "get_volume_type_by_name" to check
again if we can get this type by name.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1794237
Change-Id: I83f12a5b858aced117286e8d2dee717d14dbdba6

commit_message:
[cellv2] Improve getting BDMs in multiple cells

In nova/api/openstack/compute/extended_volumes.py,
there is a processing to get instance BDMs in multiple cells.
The 'scatter_gather_cells' method of nova.context should be used
in the processing to improve performance.

Change-Id: Ie5273774eac0b19deec50456a171c68ce54b0730

commit_message:
Build translated docs in tox

As an early bird for project doc translation we build translated docs
here with an extra script. This procedure is usual in the main doc
project, but there are different versions of the same script.
Later we to centralize such things.

Change-Id: I906be044021c93b9aeb644bcd3c550df123a3c83

commit_message:
Add stackviz directory to the list of find_log_files

This patch will add stackviz directory to be skipped to be gzipped
when collect logs

Change-Id: I98b85a89e24ac17f58c5666b50d7dac8b1206385

commit_message:
Switch test runner to django default runner

nose is not actively maintained now and Django default test runner
seems to have enough features.

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.
The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

And murano-dashboard using unittest instead of testtools.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I419e0e166ea88c3ab1203f35ffa00928cf94acb1
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/599156/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-02 17:25:08.000000000', 'message': "nimble storage: support for force detach

nimble storage driver doesn't handle force detach with empty connector
information in terminate connection. The fix takes care of empty connectors
and removing all ACL's on the volume if connector information is absent

Change-Id: I74a5b48c414db2b5b9e27d986d776d7c2ae3f383
Closes-Bug: #1795070
Signed-off-by: Raunak Kumar <rkumar@nimblestorage.com>
"}]
commit_message:
nimble storage: support for force detach

nimble storage driver doesn't handle force detach with empty connector
information in terminate connection. The fix takes care of empty connectors
and removing all ACL's on the volume if connector information is absent

Change-Id: I74a5b48c414db2b5b9e27d986d776d7c2ae3f383
Closes-Bug: #1795070
Signed-off-by: Raunak Kumar <rkumar@nimblestorage.com>

commit_message:
Correct host only routes

The host only route was adding the cidr twice which is wrong. This
change adds the missing network filter to correct the issue.

Change-Id: Ic280db301ce44b98ac35c8911999dec5fa263a29
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-08-14 18:15:58.000000000', 'message': 'consumer gen: move_allocations

This patch renames the set_and_clear_allocations function in the
scheduler report client to move_allocations and adds handling of
consumer generation conflict for it. This call now moves everything from
one consumer to another and also it retries in case of consumer
generation conflict is returned from placement. If run out of retries it
raises AllocationMoveFailed to the caller.

TODO:
* functional test shows that if move_allocation fails during migrate
  then the REST API return HTTP 500. I think this should change to 409
* functional test shows that if move_allocaton fails during the revert
  of a migration or a revert of a same host resize then instance goes
  to ERROR. I think nova should put the instance back to VERIFY_RESIZE
  and let the API user retry the operation
* make the unit test pass

Change-Id: Ie991d4b53e9bb5e7ec26da99219178ab7695abf6

'}, {'created': '2018-09-12 19:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'consumer gen: move_allocations

This patch renames the set_and_clear_allocations function in the
scheduler report client to move_allocations and adds handling of
consumer generation conflict for it. This call now moves everything from
one consumer to another and raises AllocationMoveFailed to the caller if
the move fails due to consumer generation conflict.

When migration or resize fails to move the source host allocation to the
migration_uuid then the API returns HTTP 409 and the migration is aborted.

When reverting a migration, a resize or a resize to same host fails to move
the source host allocation back to the instance_uuid due consumer generation
conflict the instance will be put to ERROR state. The instance still has two
allocations in this state and deleting the instance only deletes the one that
is held by the instance_uuid. This patch logs an ERROR describing that in this
case the allocation held by the migration_uuid is leaked.

TODO:
* Document the possible HTTP 409 return code for migrate and resize in
  the API doc.
* Add a release note describing the possible leak during migrate and
* resize revert.

Change-Id: Ie991d4b53e9bb5e7ec26da99219178ab7695abf6

commit_message:
consumer gen: move_allocations

This patch renames the set_and_clear_allocations function in the
scheduler report client to move_allocations and adds handling of
consumer generation conflict for it. This call now moves everything from
one consumer to another and raises AllocationMoveFailed to the caller if
the move fails due to consumer generation conflict.

When migration or resize fails to move the source host allocation to the
migration_uuid then the API returns HTTP 409 and the migration is aborted.

If reverting a migration, a resize, or a resize to same host fails to move
the source host allocation back to the instance_uuid due consumer generation
conflict the instance will be put into ERROR state. The instance still has two
allocations in this state and deleting the instance only deletes the one that
is held by the instance_uuid. This patch logs an ERROR describing that in this
case the allocation held by the migration_uuid is leaked.

Blueprint: use-nested-allocation-candidates
Change-Id: Ie991d4b53e9bb5e7ec26da99219178ab7695abf6

commit_message:
Query docker_root_dir from docker API

In before, we retrieve docker_root_dir from config file.
However, this infomation is available by docker API so it is
unnecessary to have such config. This commit remove the config
docker_data_dir and switch to get such information from
docker API.

Change-Id: Iafe070c6743a37444386cd431a2e310fd89620d8

commit_message:
Handle docker data root doesn't exist

In kolla, zun compute run inside a container so it couldn't
access the docker data root. Zun needs to handle this case.

Change-Id: I6882803404a1a5a6a5fe59afb1ee4b63bcd36514
Closes-Bug: #1795262

commit_message:
Git checkout version support for several projects

Kolla-ansible provides support for the dev mode for some projects
of openstack, but there are still some projects that do not yet
support specific release tag. This patch will implement this function
for these project.

Change-Id: I917b27dd61295b542457a21b240afe2cd4e83e58

The job never passes, is unmaintained, and
wastes CI resources.

subject: Disable memoized unless key has weakref
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-09-28 02:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-09-28 02:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-09-28 04:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-09-28 04:38:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

this probably would need a release note, but I can't actually seem to see many (if any) functions that have been caught by that warning in my testing."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-10-02 11:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

The whole idea of @memoize is that it caches the values indefinitely.

The whole weakref mechanism was only added to make it easier to handle functions that take objects as parameters, as a special case.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-02 21:54:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

> The whole idea of @memoize is that it caches the values
 > indefinitely.
 > 
 > The whole weakref mechanism was only added to make it easier to
 > handle functions that take objects as parameters, as a special
 > case.

Yeah, I think a LRU cache may have to be the best solution as a middle ground between caching indefinitely or not at all.

I'll throw up a quick and dirty LRU implementation based on OrderedDict and see what it acts like as well."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-10-03 07:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I wonder if we could just use https://docs.python.org/3/library/functools.html#functools.lru_cache'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-09 03:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Memoized functions that cannot have their args weakref'd will sit in
memmory indefinitely, this is bad. This makes such functions always
get called, and encourages all memoized functions to include a param
that can be weakref'd such as the request object.

Change-Id: Ifcdaa1a5ad43e2e1cb1da202055390bd6ce0826f

commit_message:
Disable memoized unless key has weakref

Memoized functions that cannot have their args weakref'd will sit in
memmory indefinitely, this is bad. This makes such functions always
get called, and encourages all memoized functions to include a param
that can be weakref'd such as the request object.

Change-Id: Ifcdaa1a5ad43e2e1cb1da202055390bd6ce0826f

commit_message:
Use python-native api to get disk size

In before, we shellout a command to retrieve the total disk size
of the host. A better approach is to leverage the python-native
library psutil to do that. Using python api would have less
overhead than spawning a shell command.

Change-Id: I02e2babac9bc36f5d738cff0b17ebd9416bd1757

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Also, bump pylint version as the old version doesn't seem working
well with python3. And fix new warnings/errors in the code.

Change-Id: I66b667d3ccdd6d6fe2415302f58125d2e3b7eb7b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Add functionality for individual cleaning on nodes

Create the object for automated clean and add the logic
in the conductor to be able to enable clean for specific
nodes, when general automated clean is disabled.

Story: #2002161
Task: #24579

Change-Id: If0130082e16d1205fdf65d083854ef9849754f8b

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:50:41.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I99ebe4dc0f09994b5a85e0258ad70de4cb76bc32
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I99ebe4dc0f09994b5a85e0258ad70de4cb76bc32
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Cinder volume driver for Inspur AS13000 series

Features that Inspur AS13000 Driver support:
Create, list, delete, attach (map), and detach (unmap) volumes
Create, list, and delete volume snapshots
Copy an image to a volume
Copy a volume to an image
Clone a volume
Extend a volume
Create a volume from a snapshot

ThirdPartySystems: INSPUR CI

Change-Id: Icbf5766dfb12f97943120b2def19a087fb76c5f8
Implements: Blueprint inspur-as13000-driver

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-26 04:28:39.000000000', 'message': "Update resource definitions after legacy in-place update

Since we remove a resource's definition after it is deleted, we must also
update a resource's definition after it is updated. Otherwise, a resource
that depended on the now-deleted resource prior to its last in-place update
could remain in the template, leaving the stack inoperable since it is
unable to calculate its own dependencies.

We already update the template in the backup stack when updating resources
in-place, and in the main stack when creating replacement resources. Also
update the main template when resources are updated in-place, not just when
they are replaced.

Change-Id: I97ddc6a970ffd27bfd40bb8f6bec8d1cbf28a815
Story: #2003612
Task: 24946
Task: 25740
(cherry picked from commit 75c912181d75f2d4db365a784687b761694ed15a
 and 8bb1cef48f1b5bc06954af63f35721937919d6d2)
"}]
commit_message:
Update resource definitions after legacy in-place update

Since we remove a resource's definition after it is deleted, we must also
update a resource's definition after it is updated. Otherwise, a resource
that depended on the now-deleted resource prior to its last in-place update
could remain in the template, leaving the stack inoperable since it is
unable to calculate its own dependencies.

We already update the template in the backup stack when updating resources
in-place, and in the main stack when creating replacement resources. Also
update the main template when resources are updated in-place, not just when
they are replaced.

Change-Id: I97ddc6a970ffd27bfd40bb8f6bec8d1cbf28a815
Story: #2003612
Task: 24946
Task: 25740
(cherry picked from commit 75c912181d75f2d4db365a784687b761694ed15a
 and 8bb1cef48f1b5bc06954af63f35721937919d6d2)

messages: [{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-06 13:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-09 00:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nFixes a performance problem. Clean backport. Very low risk.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-06 13:12:24.000000000', 'message': 'Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1
(cherry picked from commit bad27d3886797517811ade604abd8a9a91cc8a2e)
'}]
commit_message:
Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1
(cherry picked from commit bad27d3886797517811ade604abd8a9a91cc8a2e)

commit_message:
Add hide_create_volume to instance defaults

The commit [1] added the hide_create_volume option
this adds the default value for that.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605813/

Change-Id: Ic0c79ed560348b570b57108e5cb7d7302ab0442c

commit_message:
Refactor of _clone_image_volume

This patch makes _clone_image_volume more readable, and
plus negative case for it.

Note that, the change doesn't have any functional change
on the original method.

trivial_fix

Change-Id: I9e33313b4e9fd7a7701ae37cc9731885c8ea55cc

Since OpenShift 3.10, origin-sti-build is deprecated in favor of
origin-docker-builder:

https://github.com/openshift/origin/commit/57e7c6c0d45fb7f7b2e4bb6dfc13ad5b4b46d0b9

DockerOpenShiftDockerBuilderImage.

commit_message:
Switch to origin-docker-build

Since OpenShift 3.10, origin-sti-build is deprecated in favor of
origin-docker-builder:

https://github.com/openshift/origin/commit/57e7c6c0d45fb7f7b2e4bb6dfc13ad5b4b46d0b9

The new heat parameter for the image is now
DockerOpenShiftDockerBuilderImage.

Change-Id: I46def282e9bd2fd84322c8b9213ac280782f09dd
(cherry picked from commit 8bb72cadfe81b0ef16822a5ef5ed2ee1e82559ea)

commit_message:
Display policy in server groups table instead of sub table

According to [1][2], the server group policies can only contain one.
However in angular create instance server groups tab, the server
group policies are displayed in server groups sub table, it will let
users misunderstand there are multiple policies. So it is best to display
policy directly in the server groups table.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server-group
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/server_groups.py#L28

Change-Id: I9a557f90d4662005b9e0639ea564f424c37513bb
Closes-Bug:#1740661

[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:55:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update response codes for authentication API reference

The API reference for authentication and validation APIs listed some
HTTP status codes that keystone never actually uses. This commit
updates those examples to be more explicit about what keystone
returns.

Change-Id: If5cb27d1cc3fc8d8c57ccb47d1a99ba07aecba83
'}]
commit_message:
Update response codes for authentication API reference

The API reference for authentication and validation APIs listed some
HTTP status codes that keystone never actually uses. This commit
updates those examples to be more explicit about what keystone
returns.

Change-Id: If5cb27d1cc3fc8d8c57ccb47d1a99ba07aecba83

[{'created': '2018-10-06 21:27:40.000000000', 'message': "Set OpenSUSE and Bionic jobs to non-voting

The OpenSUSE jobs are always failing due to some RPM issues and
the Bionic job is always timing out.  Let's remove them for now
to be able to land code.

Change-Id: Ifae3425b66254aa655df5b6bb95896da1cccc32a

"}, {'created': '2018-10-07 15:29:04.000000000', 'message': "Disable nested virt and set SUSE+Bionic jobs to non-voting

The OpenSUSE jobs are always failing due to some RPM issues and
the Bionic job is always timing out.  Let's remove them for now
to be able to land code.

Also, it looks like OpenSUSE and CentOS are getting failures
when running with nested virt on other providers.  Let's just
get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ifae3425b66254aa655df5b6bb95896da1cccc32a

The OpenSUSE jobs are always failing due to some RPM issues and
the Bionic job is always timing out.  Let's remove them for now

Also, it looks like OpenSUSE and CentOS are getting failures

commit_message:
Disable nested virt and set SUSE+Bionic jobs to non-voting

The OpenSUSE jobs are always failing due to some RPM issues and
the Bionic job is always timing out.  Let's remove them for now
to be able to land code.

Also, it looks like OpenSUSE and CentOS are getting failures
when running with nested virt on other providers.  Let's just
get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ifae3425b66254aa655df5b6bb95896da1cccc32a

Things went well. The target of running `partprobe` is to check GPT

commit_message:
Check GPT table with sgdisk insread of partprobe

On centos7.2, it doesn't happen every time, but sometimes, partprobe
fails with error `Device or resource busy` in _fix_gpt_structs. In fact,
this is not a problem, I tried ignoring this error and ran remain code.
Things went well. The target of running `partprobe` is to check GPT
table, we can run `sgdisk -v` instead.

This patch is to replace `partprobe` command in _fix_gpt_structs to
avoid `Device or resource busy` error.

Change-Id: I43182f17b1c6229132814313f7582ab30245f6bb

commit_message:
Use openshift_cockpit_deployer_image directly

The openshift_cockpit_deployer_image variable is built from the
other variables we have below in openshift-ansible[1]. However, it is
currently failing to resolve correctly. Instead, we can just pass
the var ourselves rather than rely on openshift-ansible to correctly
construct it.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/blob/openshift-ansible-3.10.41-1/roles/cockpit-ui/defaults/main.yml#L19

Change-Id: I46755c3f66310fa2854f628bf5f129930f407761
(cherry picked from commit 7f2276b87f5c984ba74d6c7216dd9e6a5d9dfa98)

This patch adds a new role called OpenShiftInfra which is required to
define infra nodes. We've been bundling infra nodes with compute and

With the new node label management introduced in openshift-ansible, it
sounds like this is a good time for us to unbundle these nodes.

Depends-On: I291b6ac65eaa1a015bca2ee2bc1be90b0ea0aadc

"}]
commit_message:
Move to openshift-ansible 3.10

This patch adds a new role called OpenShiftInfra which is required to
define infra nodes. We've been bundling infra nodes with compute and
master nodes and they ought to be independent.

With the new node label management introduced in openshift-ansible, it
sounds like this is a good time for us to unbundle these nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I291b6ac65eaa1a015bca2ee2bc1be90b0ea0aadc
Change-Id: I4f8127a9e2d822057f3db8f0974ab1db0698985a
(cherry picked from commit e1912cd59bbd5950889cdc4a62a77c89ff42e5cf)

subject: Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools
messages: [{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-10-08 03:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-10-08 23:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 03:40:22.000000000', 'message': "Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools. Add a comment block explaining this, for
clarity, and remove the one current editor-specific entry present.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks, documentation
and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of Ib58a57267b064e4142686de6c37a70dbff04b9a7
from the openstack-dev/cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: Iaec0653405a4d30dea6a2da1e3cee43f43dc7279
"}]
commit_message:
Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools. Add a comment block explaining this, for
clarity, and remove the one current editor-specific entry present.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks, documentation
and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of Ib58a57267b064e4142686de6c37a70dbff04b9a7
from the openstack-dev/cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: Iaec0653405a4d30dea6a2da1e3cee43f43dc7279

commit_message:
Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools. Add a comment block explaining this, for
clarity, and remove the one current editor-specific entry present.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks, documentation
and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of Ib58a57267b064e4142686de6c37a70dbff04b9a7
from the openstack-dev/cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I8242a5c41b500b47b891f48220c5e7a2f3a1e83a

commit_message:
Armada: Use single rabbitmq deployment

This moves to use a single rabbitmq deployment for the openstack
services in the armada gate to reduce the resources required for
this check to run.

commit_message:
Don't run tempest jobs on changes

This library doesn't impact anything that tempest
jobs would test, so remove the zuul configuration
that runs the legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job
and tempest-full-py3 job.

Change-Id: Ie859a48824ad4a3a397e84c346129438a9193f1a

commit_message:
Remove manila driverfixes/ocata branch info

With the switch to extended maintenance, the manila team no longer needs
the driverfixes/ocata branch and it has been removed by the infra team.

To protect against the branch being accidentally recreated, this removes
the branching information from the manila ocata deliverable.

Change-Id: I44724d1b1e5e771c05abccd83dbb8752fedb80ba
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add --property option to 'server rebuild' command

Add '--property' option to the 'server rebuild' command, to provide
the ability to specify properties of the rebuilt instance.

This is equivalent to the '--meta' option of the compute's
'nova rebuild' command.

Change-Id: I25ea6622e970416090109316e1e28fab8b0b3f07
Story: #2003979
Task: #26922

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-04 01:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-08 17:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 01:40:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4c1e42cc69ad50264183635ae08de769358b36d5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4c1e42cc69ad50264183635ae08de769358b36d5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-10-07 03:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-10-08 19:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-10-08 20:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-07 03:30:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing labels to cronJobs

While implementing network policies, we noticed a handful of pods created
as part of a CronJobs are missing labels causing them to be unable to
targed by the policy. This patch set adds in the missing labels found
in that effort.

Change-Id: I1ca3cfd68ff20dc39a1e952414f3dddd3fc8d3b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing labels to cronJobs

While implementing network policies, we noticed a handful of pods created
as part of a CronJobs are missing labels causing them to be unable to
targed by the policy. This patch set adds in the missing labels found
in that effort.

Change-Id: I1ca3cfd68ff20dc39a1e952414f3dddd3fc8d3b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 13:58:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes a race condition in the hash ring code

The current hash ring code suffers from several problems:

1. The cache is reset on any get_topic_for call, which means that the
   cache is not used between API calls. Previously it was done to work
   around the situation when a new conductor is not visible until the API
   process restarts. Currently we refresh the hash rings periodically.

   This patch removes resetting the cache. To avoid waiting 2 minutes to
   be able to use a new driver:
   1) the hash ring cache is always rebuilt when a ring is not found,
   2) the hash_ring_reset_interval option was changed to 15 seconds.

2. The reset of the cache races with the hot path in the get_ring call.
   It is possible that the reset happens after the class-level cache
   variable is checked but before it is used, yielding None.

   This patch stores the value of the class-level variable to a local
   variable before checking, thus ensuring None is never returned.

Finally, some logging was added to the modified code to make this kind
of problems more debugable in the future.

Conflicts:
	ironic/common/hash_ring.py
	ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py
	ironic/tests/unit/common/test_hash_ring.py

Change-Id: I6e18c6ec23a053b59c76fcadd52b13d84d81b4fb
Story: #2003966
Task: #26896
Partial-Bug: #1792872
(cherry picked from commit 5471157e4fdb5a735a29d88f5ad3af0d4b765ea3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a race condition in the hash ring code

The current hash ring code suffers from several problems:

1. The cache is reset on any get_topic_for call, which means that the
   cache is not used between API calls. Previously it was done to work
   around the situation when a new conductor is not visible until the API
   process restarts. Currently we refresh the hash rings periodically.

   This patch removes resetting the cache. To avoid waiting 2 minutes to
   be able to use a new driver:
   1) the hash ring cache is always rebuilt when a ring is not found,
   2) the hash_ring_reset_interval option was changed to 15 seconds.

2. The reset of the cache races with the hot path in the get_ring call.
   It is possible that the reset happens after the class-level cache
   variable is checked but before it is used, yielding None.

   This patch stores the value of the class-level variable to a local
   variable before checking, thus ensuring None is never returned.

Finally, some logging was added to the modified code to make this kind
of problems more debugable in the future.

Conflicts:
	ironic/common/hash_ring.py
	ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py
	ironic/tests/unit/common/test_hash_ring.py

Change-Id: I6e18c6ec23a053b59c76fcadd52b13d84d81b4fb
Story: #2003966
Task: #26896
Partial-Bug: #1792872
(cherry picked from commit 5471157e4fdb5a735a29d88f5ad3af0d4b765ea3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 12:42:57.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0b8ef00bcf3346d35883ae6ccd107362b8017350
"}, {'created': '2018-10-08 10:11:15.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0b8ef00bcf3346d35883ae6ccd107362b8017350
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0b8ef00bcf3346d35883ae6ccd107362b8017350

commit_message:
Release openstack/manila 5.0.2 off of stable/pike

There have been a number of vendor driver
bug fixes and fixes to the core, including a
database schema fix to ensure share type
quotas work as expected.

There's a critical bugfix to the
in-tree manila_tempest_plugin that enables
deployers and certification users to not
interrupt their deployment to create manila
resources (default share/group types) in order
to invoke the tests.

Change-Id: Ib3832c2942351240e8566c0c8bfdb109e2456afd

commit_message:
Added volume usage collection, when cinder_ceilometer_enabled

In order to get volume metrics sended to ceilometer,
cinder-volume-usage-audit must be manually runned (or with cron/systemd timer).
Similar to nova approach (volume_usage_audit_period in cinder.conf)
is not working.

So this change add cinder_volume_usage_audit variable,
according to which cron job will be placed
on cinder-volumes servers.

Job uses another type of quotes, due to escaping problems

Change-Id: Iaf021f7776a73a68676d762cb84518b0db412ddd
(cherry picked from commit 4bc301ff13dc4ad742cb4a191cc016c99c7fa846)

commit_message:
Release openstack/manila 4.0.2 off of stable/ocata

There have been a number of vendor driver
bug fixes and fixes to the core, including
a fix to resolve log spamming with database
deprecation messages.

There's also a critical bugfix to the
in-tree manila_tempest_plugin that enables
deployers and certification users to not
interrupt their deployment to create manila
resources (default share/group types) in order
to invoke the tests.

Change-Id: I03cffe646f4ab91c8bcc2ca790792fffba34e972

commit_message:
SSH to node before validating services.

Having reply on SSH's port doesn't mean system is fully up
and user can log in.
To be sure system is up-n-running ssh to machine and run command
there.
Adjust syntx for 'jq' call.

Change-Id: I59387b201486fbc4c32c4146366881635ddca544
(cherry picked from commit 204787bfd6f0faba7a2ad799404ac4fac3cb0f9a)

commit_message:
scenario010: enable Ceph RBD

Enabling Ceph on scenario010 allow us to test conversion of amphora
image format from QCOW2 to RAW in octavia-undercloud role in
tripleo-common.

This patch also removes NeutronServicePlugins from being set (in line
with I3da329db28701c7e9798083982953c5c9c861c50) and unchecks Octavia
from scenario003 in the service testing matrix set previously by
mistake.

Partial-Bug: #1778303
Related-Bug: #1722758

Change-Id: I717301dc0777ecd2118253a86cd1f8353539482f

commit_message:
Fix skip of octavia-undercloud Ansible role

The migration of Octavia to external_deploy_task [1] changed the
undercloud group name from 'undercloud' to 'Undecloud' in line with [2].
Due to that, the execution of role octavia-undercloud was being skipped
as no host pattern could be matched.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559374/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588075/

Closes-Bug: #1786786
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580119

Change-Id: I50720c2f1bdb8dce92e297c4d6bfac716bb85b89

commit_message:
Import legacy jobs

Import legacy jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs and rename them
according to Zuul v3 naming conventions.

Change-Id: I56e23dd4352ee34ed2a129cc853cc33616559dca

ansible_ssh_host and ansible_host variable behave differently
when used with delegate_to keyword.
ansible_ssh_host uses value from delegate_to, while
ansible_host stays intact.

Change-Id: I3c80da359cdd1051ed590ca7e282a22a15647033
(cherry picked from commit 6d83ff95c846e97ad183595e80b32cd0405c668f)
(cherry picked from commit 3bb228cb71ad8b607b86295b02bab263f8166c52)
'}]
commit_message:
Use ansible_host variable in wait_for task.

ansible_ssh_host and ansible_host variable behave differently
when used with delegate_to keyword.
ansible_ssh_host uses value from delegate_to, while
ansible_host stays intact.

Change-Id: I3c80da359cdd1051ed590ca7e282a22a15647033
(cherry picked from commit 6d83ff95c846e97ad183595e80b32cd0405c668f)
(cherry picked from commit 3bb228cb71ad8b607b86295b02bab263f8166c52)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I37f96444426f006ff5d6491106b168a81a7c09ea

[{'created': '2018-10-02 14:36:50.000000000', 'message': 'Set container images for CNS

commit_message:
Load dm-multipath module from the host.

Until now, it's loaded from within the container, this doesn't
work with SELinux separation.

Change-Id: I3d63d1df7496d3b8a5883b07e9d40aa21153c086
Related-Bug: 1794550

commit_message:
Load ip_vs module from the host

Currently the ip_vs module is loaded from the keepalived container,
and if it works in a non-selinux separated env, it doesn't work with
podman.

Change-Id: I71e638bedde3836e05cffab53ad80bfd35313a31
Related-Bug: 1794550

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 17:16:10.000000000', 'message': 'Create flavor once only (but set flavor fact on all nodes)

By having run_once on the entire include, the set_fact only
runs on a single node which means the configuration for all
the other nodes fails.

This patch makes the play get included for everything, but
only the flavor creation happens once, with fact setting
happening on all nodes.

Change-Id: Iddd4afebb491dcf9f78f13b7ad96574f8a68e074
'}, {'created': '2018-09-28 17:21:11.000000000', 'message': 'Only run OpenStack tasks once

By having run_once on the entire include, the set_fact only
runs on a single node which means the configuration for all
the other nodes fails.

This patch makes the play get included for everything, but
only the OpenStack creation happens once, with fact setting
happening on all nodes.

Change-Id: Iddd4afebb491dcf9f78f13b7ad96574f8a68e074
'}, {'created': '2018-09-29 00:30:32.000000000', 'message': 'Only run OpenStack tasks once

By having run_once on the entire include, the set_fact only
runs on a single node which means the configuration for all
the other nodes fails.

This patch makes the play get included for everything, but
only the OpenStack creation happens once, with fact setting
happening on all nodes.

Change-Id: Iddd4afebb491dcf9f78f13b7ad96574f8a68e074
'}]
commit_message:
Only run OpenStack tasks once

By having run_once on the entire include, the set_fact only
runs on a single node which means the configuration for all
the other nodes fails.

This patch makes the play get included for everything, but
only the OpenStack creation happens once, with fact setting
happening on all nodes.

Change-Id: Iddd4afebb491dcf9f78f13b7ad96574f8a68e074

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 01:55:56.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive"

This change has breaked connectivity and containers networking
does not work anymore.  This patch reverts it until we have
a solution.

It looks like the route is failing to be installed.  No clear
idea as to why it's happening:

RTNETLINK answers: Invalid argument

This reverts commit 4f0837931baa073d750064e7e221aeb3089dbda2.

Change-Id: I0d5d63f20650db2052f187fbabdf1dcf69064bf0
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive"

This change has breaked connectivity and containers networking
does not work anymore.  This patch reverts it until we have
a solution.

It looks like the route is failing to be installed.  No clear
idea as to why it's happening:

RTNETLINK answers: Invalid argument

This reverts commit 4f0837931baa073d750064e7e221aeb3089dbda2.

Change-Id: I0d5d63f20650db2052f187fbabdf1dcf69064bf0

commit_message:
Load iscsi_tcp module from the host.

Until now, it's loaded from within the container, this doesn't work
with SELinux separation.

Change-Id: Ia2cd08b9b7950ebca4d75938ae4329641c2d6f7c
Depends-on: Ic9076a0a1a8e1360495dcf0eb766118ec63dc362
Related-Bug: 1794550

commit_message:
Ensure view args is in policy dict

The policy_dict (in enforcement) was not populating the view args
in a similar manner to the old style @protected decorator. This
change ensures that we mirror the old behavior (required for
proper use of v3cloud policy).

Conflicts:
    keystone/tests/unit/common/test_rbac_enforcer.py

Change-Id: Ida9009a95a874be9cc60c3152d4e3225726562eb
Partial-Bug: #1776504
Closes-Bug: #1792047
(cherry picked from commit 4975b79e8174587f7639347939cf679460d4896b)

OK we'll need a release and upper-constraints bump for the oslo.vmware library change:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598465

And for that allocation ratio bug, is it possible to test https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598365/ in the vmware CI to see if that helps? I see the vmware CI failed on that patch as well but it might be failing due to the oslo.vmware issue?"}, {'account_id': 9172, 'date': '2018-09-03 08:04:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> OK we'll need a release and upper-constraints bump for the
 > oslo.vmware library change:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598465
 > 

I guess we can cut a new oslo.vmware version but the above patch fixes a regression which is not present in the latest published version (2.31.0). The VMware CI is always using top-of-tree for olso.vmware.

 > And for that allocation ratio bug, is it possible to test
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598365/ in the vmware CI to see if
 > that helps? I see the vmware CI failed on that patch as well but it
 > might be failing due to the oslo.vmware issue?

It fails on a single unrelated Cinder test, it could be some infra issue. Will follow-up on the other patch."}, {'account_id': 9172, 'date': '2018-09-05 14:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

vmware-recheck-patch'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-09 16:32:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> I guess we can cut a new oslo.vmware version but the above patch fixes a regression which is not present in the latest published version (2.31.0). The VMware CI is always using top-of-tree for olso.vmware.

I don't really like the 3rd party CI doing that. I know why it does - so the CI isn't blocked while getting fixes into the library and then releasing it, but there are other ways to do that in CI like patching in changes like the xenserver CI does. Otherwise it's hard to know if the vmware CI is passing based on the actual upper-constraints based libraries we manage in openstack."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-09 16:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
VMware: Live migration of instances

This patch implements live migration of instances across compute nodes.
Each compute node must be managing a cluster in the same vCenter and ESX
hosts must have vMotion enabled [1].
If the instance is located on a datastore shared between source
and destination cluster, then only the host is changed. Otherwise, we
select the most suitable datastore on the destination cluster and
migrate the instance there.

[1] https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2054994

Co-Authored-By: gkotton@vmware.com

blueprint vmware-live-migration

Change-Id: I640013383e684497b2d99a9e1d6817d68c4d0a4b

commit_message:
Move the embedded ansible tools to its own subdir

The embedded ansible tooling has uses outside of the elk_metrics_6x
effort. This change moves the tools out so that they can be
updates/modified in an isolated work stream.

Change-Id: I4d9d067d464ac8fd0d1c8b3fdaa7f42480157fc4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup zuul jobs

Use templates instead of individual jobs.

Remoe usage of releasenotes templates since it publishes content to
docs.o.o and only official OpenStack projects can publish there, use
instead just the build jobs.

Change-Id: I3046569efd586707150fb4cc753fd55979470946

commit_message:
Fix of oslomsg undefined variables for services notifications

A buch of defaults oslomsg related variables were configured.
In case of enabling ceilometer for services, role failed unless
all required vars has been specified manually by deployer.

Also vars ceilometer_oslomsg_rpc_servers
and ceilometer_oslomsg_notify_servers were removed
They were not used anywhere except ceilometer.conf.j2
and might be easily replaced with host_group vars.
Their removal allowed to simplify macros.

Fixed distro_install functional test for ubuntu,
as ceilometer-agent-notification package was missing.

Change-Id: I148ccaff9576b09d33d889b79963e88ca84d2ffe
Closes-Bug: 1794688
